data.scheme_name: Karnataka Startup Scheme 2022-2027 - Grand Challenges Karnataka - NYI
data.benefits: Scheme provides initial grant of INR 10 Lakhs to test and demonstrate the solution and a follow-on funding of INR 50 Lakhs for deployment of solution.
data.eligibility:
Startups which are recognized by Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) are eligible under the scheme.
To avail the policy incentives and concessions entity must be registered with Karnataka Startup Cell under Karnataka Innovation& Technology Society (KITS), Department of Electronics, IT, Bt and S&T, GoK as a Startup.
data.conditions: To avail the policy incentives and concessions entity must be registered with Karnataka Startup Cell under Karnataka Innovation& Technology Society (KITS), Department of Electronics, IT, Bt and S&T, GoK as a Startup.
data.beneficiaries:
An entity shall be considered as a startup up to 10 years from the date of its incorporation.
The Startup should be working towards innovation/ improvement of existing products, services and processes and should have the potential to generate create employment.
Entity turnover has not exceeded Rs.100 crores for any of the financial years since incorporation.
data.prerequisites: To avail the policy incentives and concessions entity must be registered with Karnataka Startup Cell under Karnataka Innovation& Technology Society (KITS), Department of Electronics, IT, Bt and S&T, GoK as a Startup.
data.nodal_agency:
Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society (KITS)
Karnataka Startup Cell
data.context: To play a vital role in creating an enabling environment across the State for nurturing startups throughout their business lifecycle and make Karnataka a global innovation hub for startups.
data.objective: The main aim is to strengthen government institutions and support emerging clusters outside Bengaluru, foster innovation and entrepreneurship skills in students, promote the growth of startups  facilitate technology solutions for social challenges, and improve funding avenues for startups through various means including government support.
data.description: Each year 3 challenges will be announced in collaboration and funding support of different Government Departments/Corporates. The winners will be awarded an initial grant of Rs 10 Lakhs to test and demonstrate the solution and a follow-on funding of Rs 50 Lakhs for deployment of solution.
data.how_to_apply: Startups have to register on Karnataka Startup portal ( Karnataka Startup Cell) and then they can fill Annexure as per requiremnts for benefits from Karnataka Statup Portal.
data.funding_mechanism: Once Startup is approved for his innovative products by Karnataka Startup Cell they will be granted with Karnataka Startup Certificate by Karnataka Government and then have to apply through portal online for benefits after this all the benefits will be reimbursed based on approval by Startup Cell.
data.checklist_info_a:
KYC 
DPIIT
Incorporationn certificate
Karnataka Startup Certificate
Detailed Project report
Proper proof of concept for product/service
